aboutMe.paragraph1: I'm Beth, a Full Stack Developer from the UK, living in BarcelonağŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸. I used to be a dentist ğŸ¦·, (possibly holding the title for the youngest ever retired dentist?) before I made the brave leap into tech. I recently graduated from a Full Stack Bootcamp at CodeOp - the best decision I've ever made.  I went from problem solving complex treatment plans to problem solving code - it's pretty much the same thing, right?
aboutMe.paragraph2: I fell in love with the logic and functionality of code and never looked back. We were so lucky in the Bootcamp to gain experience in a wide range of technologies, but I won't bore you with a list - feel free to dive into my Resume, or check out the videos of my projects.ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’»
aboutMe.paragraph3: 'But surely coding isn't all you do?!' I hear you say. Okay, okay, I do have some other hobbies. I love to run, it helps me start the day with a clear head. I love to climb, the sense of fear and accomplishment is addictive. I love to eat delicious food with my favourite people. I've been lucky enough to travel to and live in lots of different countries ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡µğŸ‡­ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸, giving me an open mind and a sense of perspective.

projects.project1: Have you ever started on a health journey with all the motivation in the world, but somewhow not managed to keep it up long term? The 'Feel better in 5' app is designed to help time poor people stay healthy. The easier the plan is, the more likely you are to stick to it. The full stack app was created in a one week sprint, take a look at the video walkthrough to see the technologies used and the future features I'm currently working on.     ğŸ‘‰
projects.project2: Eco-warriors is an e-commerce site for users to to order ethically sourced, zero-waste products delivered to their door, sorted into helpful categories. This was a collaborative project created in the final weeks of the bootcamp, where I was mainly responsible for the JWT authentication, functionality and styling of the products page, the end points and fetch requests. If you want to see more, take a look at the video I made.   ğŸ‘‰
